conclusion: Understanding the problem setup with a point light source, a ball thrown vertically, and a shadow on the wall.
Assumption about the light source height and the wall being perpendicular.
Ball's horizontal position remains constant while its height changes due to gravity.
Shadow of the ball moves as the ball rises and falls.
Visualizing the setup with points L (light source), P (midpoint), and the wall.
Need to find the initial velocity of the shadow.
Defining h(t) as the height of the ball and s(t) as the shadow's position.
Using the equation h(t) = v_0 t - (1/2) g t^2 for the ball's height.
Attempting to relate h(t) and s(t) using similar triangles.
Initial incorrect setup of similar triangles: h(t)/x = s(t)/d.
Correcting similar triangles relation to h(t)/x = s(t)/(d-x).
Realizing mistake in similar triangles setup and re-evaluating.
Defining positions L, W, P, B(t), and S(t) for clarity.
Re-evaluating similar triangles with L B(t) and L S(t).
